title: The Golden Compass - December 2007
content:
[url=http://pdl.stream.aol.com/newline/gl/newline/trailers/GC/GoldenCompass_TSR1_High_dl.mov]pdl.stream.aol.com/newlin...igh_dl.mov[/url]

Thats the trailer. For those of you who have read Phillip Paulman's series, the same people who directed Lord of the Rings is bringing you The Golden Compass. One thing I liked was in the trailer the first song was "Mars : The Bringer of War" - If that titles right, ah well. You know what I mean.

Discuss.

EDIT: BTW, more on the movie at [url=http://goldencompassmovie.com]goldencompassmovie.com[/url]

title: Re: The Golden Compass - December 2007
content:
I thought it looked pretty stupid. From the trailer, it looked like they just threw together a lot of elements from other fantasy movies.
But who knows? It might be good.-Genius314

title: Re: The Golden Compass - December 2007
content: I don't quite get what was wrong with the name "Northern Lights", which is the title of the book in the UK. Oxford looks much more futuristic than it is portrayed in the books, and I don't really think it fits that well. Otherwise, it looks like it could be alright.[url=http://toxicsheep.com]toxicsheep.com[/url] | [url=http://commanderkeen.org]coming up next...[/url]

title: Re: The Golden Compass - December 2007
content:
Frankly, I'm not interested in this one. Haven't read those books either.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

content: The books were quite good, so I'm hopeful. title: Welp,
content:
The book is ingenious.

Genius- the funny about that is that he took elements in the original book from all kinds of other fantasy books. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]

Ever read the trilogy "His Dark Materials"? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

title: Re: Welp,
content: The Golden Compass was cool, despite being in a sort of typical fantasy universe. The second book was cool because it did a 180 and brought the characters into the real world. The third book was cool because they killed God, but it was okay, because he was an evil bastard.[center]<font color="MAROON">TOUGH GUYS DON'T FOLLOW FADS</font>[/center]

title: Re: Welp,
content:
I just think hes a good writer. Its the only book I've read that an adult would give me that wasn't like, so dumbed down, or having such a retarded plot.__________________________________________

title: great books
content:
I thought those books were seriously amazing, perhaps my favorite fiction books, definitely my favorite fantasy books. I just hope they don't screw up the movie. If they do a good job ... this is going to be excellent.

(A stroll down memory lane ... a few years ago, I made a post in the misc forum here talking about how I really liked these books. Just so you know. It's almost certainly gone now ... good old ezboard.)
